entry.title: Re: Integration between S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and...
entry.content:
Hi JordanoJ,

 

let's start at the beginning: what exactly do you try to accomplish? Do you want to receive bank statement files? If yes and only that then you could possibly use the SOAP API (BANKSTATEMENTPOST_IN). But you cannot send anything using this SOAP API. Because you asked "After that, should this structure be transformed into a .txt file format to be sent to the bank via SFTP?"

Again this API is an inbound API, you can send files into S/4 using this API, nothing is coming out of this. Let's be clear about this.

 

And now I need your answer to my question, because to me this sounds like you want to send out files to your bank. This won't work with this API.

 

Best,

Edrilan Berisha

entry.title: Re: SAP Mobile Start via SAP Start Booster – No Apps or P...
entry.content:
Hello @Vijjusk  @adnanmaqbool 

If you're seeing "Currently, there aren't any products for you" after setting up SAP Start (Foundation Plan), it’s because no content or roles have been assigned to your user.

The Foundation Plan includes trust and connectivity but does not support content federation or Launchpad Content Manager, so that apps won’t appear automatically.

To resolve this,

  • It is recommended to upgrade to SAP Build Work Zone – Standard Plan to enable content federation and proper role-based access.
  •  Possible workaround is to manually create tiles with app URLs — not scalable for production use

Explaining the Architecture of SAP Build Work Zone

SAP Build Work Zone: Frequently asked Questions

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Handling Unit in packing process
entry.content:
My scenario:

phisically, people would like to pack a finished goods into packaging material and create a handling unit. They want to pack it after the production has been finished. So if they produce 1 customized bottle of water, they will pack it into one box and after getting 10 bottles inside, they get another box. That's why they would like to create the handling unit at the end of production. Then they phisically transport it to warehouse, and based on a handling unit they would like to create outbound delivery. So they have handling unit no. 1000 with 10 customized bottles related to 2 different sales order and they would like to create 2 outbound deliveres based on that handling unit. 

I don't know if that's possible in Standard SAP.

entry.title: CAP + SAPUI5 - How does auth work?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am currently developing an application with the following components:

- CAP backend,

- FE Frontend

- Several SAPUI5 (Freestyle) Frontends

Up until now I have only used auth: mocked or dummy. This way, the connections between front- and backend have worked seamlessly. Now, after having deployed my SAPUI5 frontends to the HTML5 repo and trying to do POST requests against the backend I get a 403 - forbidden response (works however in BAS dev env and Postman) - also the GET requests from the very same SAPUI5 Apps work. I have done some research on this and most articles were suggesting CORS / CSRF issues but I also read that this is handled automatically by the SAPUI5 Framework. Further research suggested that deployed apps require proper token based authentication, which is why I am trying to setup XSUAA now. However, I am having a hard time wrapping my head around this as to what is exactly required for my frontends, backend, managed approuter,..etc.. Thus, I am asking you for some guidance regarding these topics / my issue. 

Regards,

Oliver

entry.title: Re: Recalculation in termination for the whole year with...
entry.content:
Yes this is the current situation . The termination rule is called only for terminated month.

I can see the below options:

1.  Import TMRE (Time management recalculation event ) from a particular date Say April. This will ensure that the accrual recalculation is called each month after april. The termination workflow could notify a time admin who does this from MDF Import or you could schedule automated imports of TMRE on a regular basis for this employee group via MDF import by placing files in SFTP.  https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3598136 . Please note if you plan to automate TMRE imports, it will run for all employees (the employees mentioned in the file) and not just the terminated employee. Hence please ensure that this method is used only where the company has relatively less employees < 2k for example. Else the time admin has to do it manually 

2. I am not 100% sure of this option..Just an idea because I have heard partners doing this. If you have CPI or BTP, You can perhaps do the following. Use intelligent services on Job Info termination event to call Integration Center. And from Integration center/or IS itself you can call an CPI Iflow. In the custom CPI iflow, you would get the payload with affected terminated user. Use this detail to create a file only for that user with TMRE event in SFTP server (similar to idea 1.). And then the MDF import picks this file from SFTP and imports the TMRE.

Regards

Neelesh

entry.title: Re: Unable to find my deployed Processes and triggers in...
entry.content:
Hi,

Please look into SAP Note 3428234

Enhancements made to SAP Build Process Automation has resulted in a new location for monitoring Triggers.

Please go to Control Tower -> Environments, select the relevant environment and then the Triggers tab. There you can add and manage your triggers.

Regards

entry.title: Re: S/4HANA Product Compliance - Dangerous Goods Management
entry.content:
Hello

1.) if you are using On Prem 2023 version => it is strongly recommended to do an upgrade if the new version 2025 is released

2.) if you are using a "cloud" versioN: the same is true. Try to stay "current" with the software

Coming back to your questions and reading between the lines:

We have in SAP two main option to "pack" (according to my understanding). You pack via "production order" or via "delivery"

Now the product compliance process has a "totally" different design than EHS classic.

The main focus topic is the "material" and how it is used in the process.

I have not checked in detail: but step one would be: you try to sell a "material". Now you have an "Issue". Because the concept of "packed" / "unpacked" is (from my point of view) "strange" in PC:

Example: if you sell material via "tank ship" we call that a "bulk transport". But according to best knowledge: In PC you must handled this material as "packed" if you would like to use the "full" integration.

Let us assume this: you have a materia called "EasyClean". this you produce. Now you have two options:

Either you store that in a "tank" or you "pack" it in e.g. 1 l plastic bottle. For the later case: You have clearly now a "packed" material. So then you should handled this as "packed" material in "PC"

In a nutshell: if we talk about material which are "sold" regularly: > 90% of the companies (which i know)  have a specific "set" how they sell the material; e.g. 250 ml bottle, 500 mlg bottle and whatsoever.

In such cases: it makes sense to make the "DG classification" upfront

I strictly recommend to check the "roadmap" explorer to get insight which functionally will come in "cloud" or "on prem".

But if you need details: please get in touch with SAP direct, They can explain the best what is supported now and will be supported in e.g. on prem version 2025

Wish you the best

C.B.

PS: may be check again: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/35751be3d6ee423197492574e016a512/6803deda94b94ff29c42af2653501cf1.html?locale=en-US

as well as: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/35751be3d6ee423197492574e016a512/e32a47c4b2b34d91889a12c7fc2d06b3.html?locale=en-US

and may be: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/35751be3d6ee423197492574e016a512/cdf214b2744b4eeb817b41724d9319a8.html?locale=en-US

and: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/35751be3d6ee423197492574e016a512/44bc76a88b304e17b8027ef8e31a3b3b.html?locale=en-US

entry.title: Seeking advice for career roadmap
entry.content:
Hello Experts, I'm seeking your guidance on the next steps in my SAP career.

I have over 6 years of hands-on experience in SAP MM, including multiple end-to-end implementation projects. Currently, I'm working in India, but I'm now aiming to gain global exposure, especially in the Gulf region, by working with global consulting firms or end-users. Right now I don't have any offers from the gulf region right now but is looking forward to work in the gulf region.

I already hold a certification in SAP MM (C_TS452) - SAP Certified Associate - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, Sourcing and Procurement

To progress further, I want to understand:

Should I expand into SAP EWM, SAP TM, SAP Ariba or any other module?

If yes then which module. What should be the priority list to learn the next modules.

If SAP Ariba is the right direction, which modules should I focus on (e.g., Sourcing, Procurement, Contracts)?

How should I design my career roadmap from here onward to align with global market trends and maximize my opportunities abroad?

I would also like to explore the functionalities of AI and ML in SAP. 

I would truly appreciate advice from senior SAP consultants or those who've made a similar transition. Thanks in advance for your valuable suggestions

entry.title: CDS views - Error "The table name x is unknown or obscured by an alias"
entry.content:
Hello, I have the two following CDS views. The second one is extending the first one, but getting error "The table name _Status is unknown or obscured by an alias" on lines 5 and 6. Can someone kindly help me understand what's the cause?

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #CHECK
@EndUserText.label: 'Process Order Status'
@VDM.viewType: #COMPOSITE
@AccessControl.personalData.blocking: #NOT_REQUIRED
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType: {serviceQuality: #C, sizeCategory: #XL, dataClass: #MIXED}
@VDM.lifecycle.contract.type: #PUBLIC_REMOTE_API

define view entity A_ProcessOrderStatus_2
 as select from P_APIOrderStatus as _Status

  association [1..1] to A_ProcessOrder             as _ProcessOrder   on  $projection.ManufacturingOrder = _ProcessOrder.ProcessOrder
  {
  @ObjectModel.sapObjectNodeTypeReference: 'ProductionOrder'
  key cast(_Status.ManufacturingOrder      as co_bid preserving type) as ManufacturingOrder,     
  key _Status.StatusCode,
      // Status  
      cast (case when _Status.StatusCode like 'E%' then 'X' else '' end as vdm_j_isuserstatus) as IsUserStatus, 
      
      cast( case 
         when _UserStatusText.UserStatus is null then _Status.SystemStatusShortName else _UserStatusText.UserStatusShortName
         end as j_txt04 preserving type )          as StatusShortName,                                                     
         
      cast(case 
        when _UserStatusText.UserStatus is null then _Status.SystemStatusName else _UserStatusText.UserStatusName        
        end as j_txt30 preserving type )           as StatusName,                                                                                                        
        _ProcessOrder
                
} 
where 
// _Status.StatusIsHidden = '' and 
 _Status.ManufacturingOrderCategory = '40'
@AbapCatalog.sqlViewAppendName: 'example_table'
@EndUserText.label: 'Extend View for A_ProcessOrderStatus_2'
extend view A_ProcessOrderStatus_2 with example_view_extend
{
 _Status.StatusIsInactive,
 _Status.StatusObject as ObjectNumber
}

entry.title: At least one IBP Write Batch could not be created" during IBP master data upload via CI
entry.content:
Hi SAP Experts,

I'm trying to load LOCATION master data from SAP Integration Suite (CPI) to SAP IBP using the IBP Write API.

In my integration flow, I first create the batch using this payload:

Then I use a Groovy script to convert CSV to JSON and wrap it in the following payload:

However, I get the following error:
javax.script.ScriptException: java.lang.Exception: java.lang.Exception: At least one IBP Write Batch could not be created.

I have verified:

  • BatchKey is the same in both steps.

  • CSV structure and field names are correct.

  • IBP destination in BTP is properly configured.

  • The user has the required roles (SAP_IBP_INTEGRATION) and access to planning area ZHCRVRDEM.

Can someone help me understand why the batch creation might be failing? How can I trace this better or fix it?

Thanks in advance!

 



SAP Integration Suite SAP Integrated Business Planning SAP Integration Suite, managed gateway for spend management and SAP Business Network

APPEND ls_XXX TO lt_u.

entry.title: Re: Extended situation handling issues on SAP S/4HANA 202...
entry.content:
Hello @Lakshmipathi , @axel_spriestersbach 

hope you're doing well.

As recommended by Mr. @Lakshmipathi , I explored the scenario based on batch job execution, which initially  worked correctly. During this process, I identified the technical job SIT2_RT_BATCH as a potential solution to schedule our custom situation type to run every 30 minutes (or more frequently).

I attempted to configure and run this job, but unfortunately, it runs without detecting any active situation type – even when a valid instance exists.

Here are the steps I followed (as per SAP standard documentation on the Help Portal):

  1. ✅ Maintained the required authorizations and generated a profile for the role SAP_CA_SITN_ENGINE_WF

  2. ✅ Assigned this role to the technical user SAP_WFRT(See Capture 2)

  3. ✅ Maintained this user in transaction SJOBREPO_STEPUSER (See Capture 3)

  4. ✅ Scheduled the job using transaction SJOBREPO, setting it to run every 1 minute

  5. After that, I checked the SIT2_RT_BATCH logs:

     

  • The job is executing every minute as expected by the technical user SAP_WFRT .

  • However, no situation type is detected – despite having relevant data. ( see capture ) 

  • My question :

Is there something I’m missing in the configuration that prevents the job from consistently detecting the active situation type and generating notifications when instances exist?

Any insights or guidance would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support!

Mben!!

Afterwards, I deleted the published records from the Compensation Portlet in EC for this user and tried publishing again. I received the following error: "It is not supported to change effective date/ event reason/ publish order on 2nd+ publish.".

I deleted the worksheet, launched it again, and tried to publish results however, the error message remains. Could you tell me what the issue is? In the past I have always published multiple times from 1 form, when i was trying different configurations. I never saw this error before. 

 

Thanks

Rebecca

entry.title: Re: SAP APIM external Logging using New Relic
entry.content:
Following the instructions from the following link will work on Mac/Linux environments. 
TLDR:
1. Create a local folder to unzip the exported file into.

mkdir myproxydir
unzip ./<exportedFile>.zip -d myproxydir

2. After you have made changes, zip the folder content for upload

cd myproxydir
zip my-new-proxy.zip -r .

 Try this first without making any changes, so you can isolate issues. 

Common issue is that when you add fault rules and new policies, also add the policies with their types to the main proxy xml file. The error message you will see identifies missing types for the policies.

Arun

In the copy control of delivery to billing document the source of the price is specified in the Price Source field. The standard or usual configuration is to copy the price in the PO and since the delivery has no price.

If you want to copy the price from the delivery the first thing would to have a price there and then change the copy control specified above.

entry.title: Lease contract condition
entry.content:
hi all 

i have a lease contract valid from 2022 till 2030. in this contract i have below clearing : 

3.04.2021-2.04.2024 270,000 (three payment advance already posted) 

3.4.2024 - 2.04.2027 270,000 (three payment advance already posted) 

3.04.2027 - 2.4.2028 (one payment, not posted yet) 

3.04.2028 - 2.4.2029 (one payment, not posted yet) 

in 2025 i want to let the payment which is already posted in 3.4.2024 - 2.04.2027 270,000 (three payment advance already posted)  to become only one payment 90,000 in 2025 

what the right steps i have to follow since at the end i want to end the contract in 2025 and payment in 2025 only 90,000 rather than 270,000

entry.title: Developing a Customized AR Aging Analysis Report in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud - Part 1
entry.content:
Introduction:

Hello everyone, Myself Sriram Balaji, I am currently working as an SAP FICO Consultant. Last year, I got an opportunity to work in SAP Public Cloud Greenfield Implementation Project. During the “FIT to Standard” and “UAT” sessions, we have demonstrated the SAP standard Customer / Supplier Aging Analysis Report to the client but they are not satisfied with the standard aging report. They required a tailored Aging Analysis Report for Customer and Supplier, one that aligned perfectly with their unique operational requirements. This experience highlighted the importance of understanding client expectations beyond standard functionalities and fueled my journey into customizing SAP solutions in the Public Cloud.

In this blog, we are going to explore how we can develop Customized Customer (AR) Aging Analysis Report using the “Key User Extensibility” in the SAP Public Cloud.

 

Purpose of Preparing Customer Aging Analysis Report:

Customer Aging Analysis Report, is a basic financial report which provides the information of outstanding payment from the customer’s and how long they are due for the payment by categorizing into the Aging Buckets (0 – 30 Days, 31 – 60 Days, ……. Above 365 Days).

The aging report provides vital information to management to evaluate how effective the business is at converting sales to cash. The aging report is also used as a tool for estimating potential bad debts, which are then used to revise what is known as the allowance for doubtful accounts.

 

Key-User Extensibility in SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud:

Extensibility covers a broad spectrum of topics that enable customers and partners to adapt standard business software to their business needs.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud key user extensibility allows adapting standard functionalities to user requirements without the need for any external tools. Key User Extensibility is done in the customizing tenant of the development system through SAP Fiori apps designed to facilitate someone making small changes to apps, reports, and email and form templates without any coding experience.

Here's an overview of the things you can do using key user extensibility tools:

  • Change and adapt the UIs for SAP Fiori Apps
  • Create Custom Fields
  • Create your own custom templates or extend the standard forms and email templates
  • Create customer-specific CDS Views
  • Enhance the current business process by creating custom business logic
  • Create a new custom user interface
  • Create custom business objects

SAP S/4HANA embodies key user extensibility tools, which are completely web-based. They are targeted at key users who have a deep knowledge of the product itself, but not necessarily a very deep technical knowledge.

For more details about Extensibility in SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud, please refer the link https://extensibilityexplorer.cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com/ExtensibilityExplorer/#/ReadMore

To develop the Customized Customer Aging Analysis Report, we are going to use the below Key-User Extensibility Apps and other provided Apps by SAP in the Public Cloud:

  • Custom CDS View APP
  • Custom Analytical Queries APP
  • View Browser APP
  • Custom Catalog Extensions APP

My prior experience in developing Aging Analysis Reports in SAP ECC and S/4HANA GUI with my technical team allowed me to apply the same logic to Custom CDS Views and Custom Analytical Queries, even without knowing any deep technical knowledge.

Let me summarize the business requirement for Customer Aging Analysis before jumping into the technical steps involved for the development:

  • The report should display: Customer Account, Customer Name, Document Number, Line Item, Document Type, GL Account, Payment Terms (with descriptions), and other required fields.
  • The report should calculate and present: Overdue Days, Not Yet Due, Aging Buckets (0-30 days, 31-60 days, …... and Above 365 days), and Total Overdue Amount.
  • The report balances must be matched with the 'Manage Customer Line Items' App (Accounts Receivable Ledger).

 

In this Part - 1, We will explore how we can utilize the Custom CDS View APP for the AR Aging Analysis Report development.

 

Custom CDS View:

Custom CDS views can serve different purposes: They can be consumed in analytics or serve as external APIs to be consumed in external systems, for instance the SAP BTP. Especially Cube or Dimension views can be used in analytical scenarios and also you can create or modify a custom CDS view by,

  • Adding fields from multiple data sources.
  • Creating your own calculated fields.
  • Refining the properties of the selected fields.
  • Creating and maintaining parameters for the usage within your view.

We have combined the multiple data sources such as I_JournalEntryOperationalView, _I_GLAccountText, and _I_PaymentTermsText to create a Custom CDS View by using the Join Condition.

 

Step – 1: Open the APP – Custom CDS View

Click on “Create”.

 

Enter the “Label”, Choose the “Scenario” – “Analytical Cube” and Click on “Create” Button.

Note: By choosing the Scenario as “Analytical Cube”, We can use this CDS View to create an Analytical Queries for the Customer Aging Analysis report.

 

Step – 2: Choose the Primary Data Source 

Click on “Add” Button

Choose the “Primary Data Source”

Note: Data Source is an object containing the key figures and characteristics from the database and it provides a multidimensional analytical view of business data.

 

Select the respective “I_JournalEntryOperationalView” Data Source from the list.

 

This I_JournalEntryOperationalView CDS view provides access to all details of a journal entry item (database table ACDOCA) joined to the details of the corresponding operational accounting document item (database table BSEG) and to the details of the corresponding journal entry header (database table BKPF) including the most important business entity, such as G/L account, Cost Center or Profit Center.

So, this I_JournalEntryOperationalView is similar to the ACDOCA Table which contains the values of all the relevant fields related to the Accounting Document.

 

Step – 3: Choose the Associated Data Sources

Click on “Associated Data Sources”

Note: Associated Data Sources will help us to combine the two different data sources into one CDS View by using a join condition set between two or more equal characteristics present in the Primary Data Source – A and Associated Date Sources – B that contains the same data type.

For Example:

The primary data source "I_JournalEntryOperationalView" does not include the "Payment Terms Description" field. Therefore, we must join it with the associated data source "I_PaymentTermsText" using a join condition to retrieve this field.

Select the “Join Condition” Icon.

 

Click on “Add”

 

Choose the common field that available in the both Primary & Associated Data Source to join.

 

Select the Value Type as “Field”

Click on F4 in the Value Field.

 

Find the corresponding "Payment Terms" mapping field in the Primary Data Source to link it with the field in the Associated Data Source.

 

Select the Value Type as “Session Variable”

Choose the Value as “System Language” and Click on “Close” button.

 

Step – 4: Choose the Elements (Fields) to be added in the CDS View

In the Elements Section, Click on “Add” button and Choose “Elements”.

In the Elements selection pop up screen,

Choose the “Elements (Fields)” from “I_JournalEntryOperationalView” you want to display in the CDS view and then Click on “OK”.

Total 142 Elements (Fields) have been selected for the CDS view.

 

Step – 5: Create User Defined Parameters

User-Defined Parameters:

Parameters usually require data input when your custom CDS view is executed. This data can then be used like a variable e.g. in filters, calculated fields or even in a join condition to another view. You can then refine them or just create your own parameters if you need them.

The Customer Aging Analysis Report will operate based on "Open Items at Key Date," mirroring the functionality found in reports like "Manage Customer Line Item" or "FBL5N."

The "Open Items at Key Date" logic ensures that when the report is run for a specific date (which can be in the past, present, or future), it will only display items that meet following criteria mentioned below:

  • The open items (Invoices, Payments, & Advances) were not yet cleared as of the specified key date will be included in the report.
  • The open items (Invoices, Payments, & Advances) were cleared after the specified key date will be included in the report.
  • The open items (Invoices, Payments, & Advances) were cleared before the specified key date will be excluded from the report.

This "Key Date" will serve as a crucial input on the report's selection screen, driving the logic for determining which open items are included in the Customer Aging Report.

In the Parameters Section, Click on “Add” button,

Enter the following information:

  • Name: Technical Name
  • Label: Name to be displayed in the output of the parameter
  • Data Type: “DATS” – Date (YYYYMMDD Format) Data type of the parameter.
  • Default Type and Value: “Manual” - Enter a manual parameter value in accordance with the data type syntax, e.g. for the data type DATS enter a manual value in the format YYYYMMDD.

Now the “Open Items at Key Date” Parameter is created. 

 

Step – 6: Add User Defined Parameters in the Elements (Fields)

In the Elements Section, Click on “Add” Button and Choose the “Parameters”.

Select the created “Open Items at Key Date” Parameter and Click on “OK” button.

Now the “Open Items at Key Date” Parameter has been added in the Elements.

 

Step – 7: Using “Filter” Applying the Logic for the Customer Aging Analysis Report

You can filter the information shown in your custom CDS view by setting up a condition, just like using the WHERE clause in SQL. This condition provides the view exactly what data to show.

Think of it like this:

The CDS view (I_JournalEntryOperationalView) which we are using that shows all the Accounting Document transactions in line item wise.

  • If you want to display only Customer related Accounting Transactions, you'd set a condition like "Account Type is equal to “D".
  • Or, if you only want to see Normal Transactions (Invoices, Payments) & Special GL Transactions (Advances), your condition would be "Special GL Code equal to “BLANK”, & “A”.

Once you set this condition (using either a simple editor or a form-based one), your CDS view will automatically filter its results, showing only the open items that match what you asked for. It's a way to fine-tune the data you see without having to look through everything.

We can use the form-based version to define simple filter conditions. In case you want to define more complex conditions, we can use expression-based version. Here, we have used expression-based version.

As per business requirement, to ensure the Customer Aging Analysis Report balances match with the "Manage Customer Line Items" balances, we've set up specific conditions for these fields: Account Type, Special GL Code, Posting Date, and Clearing Date in the Filter section using expression-based version.

 

Step – 8: Create Calculation Elements (Fields) – Overdue Days & Payment Terms Days

In the Elements section, click on “Add” button and Choose “Calculation” to create Overdue Days & Payment Terms Days fields for the report.

  1. Overdue Days

Enter the following information:

  • Name: Technical Name
  • Label: Name to be displayed in the output of the parameter
  • Choose as “Function” and Choose “Function Type – Date and Time”
  • Choose the respective “Function - DATS_DAYS_BETWEEN” and apply the below mentioned formula.
  • Then click on “Create”.

Note: The function DATS_DAYS_BETWEEN calculates the difference between two specified dates, date1 and date2, in days. The actual parameters must have the predefined data type DATS and should contain a valid date in the format YYYYMMDD.

The Formula we have applied to calculate the Overdue Days is Open Items Key Date (which was created as parameter for report execution) MINUS Net Due Date. 

 

  1. Payment Terms Days

Enter the following information:

  • Name: Technical Name
  • Label: Name to be displayed in the output of the parameter
  • Choose as “Function” and Choose “Function Type – Date and Time”
  • Choose the respective “Function - DATS_DAYS_BETWEEN” and apply the below mentioned formula.
  • Then click on “Create”.

The Formula we have applied to calculate the Payment Terms Days is Net Due Date MINUS Baseline Date.

Created Calculation Elements (Fields) for the report.

In the Element Properties Section, Maintain the Aggregation method as “No Operation” for the created Payment Term Days & Overdue Days Fields to convert the field into calculated measure for creating the Aging Buckets in the Custom Analytical Query APP.

 

Step – 9: Preview and Publish the created CDS view

In the Log section, check any error need to rectified before preview the CDS view.

Click on “Preview Data” button to display the values are coming as per the logic or not.

 

Created CDS View no of line items are matching with the Manage Customer Line Items.

Calculated Fields (Overdue Days, Payment Terms Days) are displaying with values in the CDS View according formula we have applied in the calculation function.

Once Check is successful, Go to “Next Steps” section.

Click on “Publish” button to publish the Created CDS View for Creating Analytical Queries.

In Part - 2, we'll dive into using the Custom Analytical Queries APP with our newly created Custom CDS View to build an AR Aging Analysis Report.

entry.title: Re: How to Enable Auto-Approval for Leaves of Three Days...
entry.content:
Hi @RajeevZ

For auto-approval, job has to be set/trigger from SF Provisioning instance which has to run on daily basis.

Based on the number of days defined in the workflow for auto-approval, when the job runs from provisioning instance, if the auto-approval days are matching from the initiation date then the workflow gets auto-approved.

Thanks

Arun

entry.title: SAP EWM Physical Inventory with /SCWM/PI_COUNTLIST
entry.content:
As an SAP EWM consultant, I often come across warehouses that still rely on paper-based inventory counts. Not every site uses RF devices or mobile solutions for physical inventory. For those environments, SAP provides a very handy transaction: /SCWM/PI_COUNTLIST.

In this blog, I’d like to share a quick insight into /SCWM/PI_COUNTLIST tcode. Whether you're printing paper-based count lists or just exploring physical inventory processes, this blog will help you get started.

 

The /SCWM/PI_COUNTLIST transaction takes the items from your physical inventory (PI) documents and formats them in a structured layout that warehouse staff can use to record counted quantities by hand. This is especially helpful in warehouses without RF devices.

As follows once a PI document has been created (/SCWM/PI_CREATE), you can use /SCWM/PI_COUNTLIST by entering PI document number.

Mark the "Storage Bin Empty" checkbox if the storage bin is physically empty, or select "PI Zero Count" if no stock is found for that specific material during the physical count.

Use the "Quantity in AUoM" field to enter the actual counted quantity in the alternative unit of measure as shown in the screenshot above.

Also by selecting the relevant item and clicking the "Display PI Doc Item" button, the system will navigate you directly to the /SCWM/PI_PROCESS screen, where you can view and enter the physical inventory details.

While /SCWM/PI_COUNTLIST is great for many physical inventory scenarios, it's important to understand that this transaction was designed primarily for simple stock structures such as products placed directly in storage bins, or basic cases like a product in a handling unit (HU), with the HU stored in a bin.

However, it does not support complex inventory structures, such as handling unit hierarchies and serial number managed products.

If you're working with any of these scenarios you should use /SCWM/PI_PROCESS or /SCWM/PI_COUNT instead. These transactions provide more flexibility and visibility for complex counting scenarios. (https://me.sap.com/notes/3265297/E)

 

Even in today’s digital warehouses, manual processes still exist and sometimes they’re necessary. /SCWM/PI_COUNTLIST helps bridge the gap between system data and manual operations. It gives warehouse workers a clear, organized way to count stock and ensures that physical inventory processes stay reliable, even without mobile tools.

This was a small but useful function that I believe doesn’t get enough attention. If your site handles manual counting make sure you check out /SCWM/PI_COUNTLIST. It’s simple to use, easy to adjust, and can make physical inventory runs much smoother.

 

Thanks for reading!

Note;

If you performed your physical inventory count using Excel and want to upload the results into the system all at once, you can use the PI_UPLOAD process and for that you can check the following blog post;

https://community.sap.com/t5/supply-chain-management-blog-posts-by-members/ewm-physical-inventory-pi-upload-transaction/ba-p/13430503

 

References

Processing of Physical Inventory Documents | SAP Help Portal

Compare Physical Inventory IM - WM - EWM - SAP Community

About the limitations;

https://me.sap.com/notes/3265297/E

https://me.sap.com/notes/3375080/E

https://me.sap.com/notes/3401785/E

entry.title: Accelerating Implementation with SAP Activate in the Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Readers, 

Today we will discuss about accelerating SAP implementations using SAP Activate methodology in the Public Cloud. 

SAP implementation has been going on for over a year, the budget is as well goes to high, and you're still not sure when you'll go live, sometimes I've seen projects gets drag, teams getting frustrated, and businesses losing patience.  

Due to these challenges companies are going with Public cloud implementation as implementation has been completed in less time compared to S/4HANA implementation, with the help of SAP Activate methodology. 

 What is SAP Activate? 

SAP Activate is step-by-step guide from SAP that helps companies quickly and efficiently set up and start using SAP S/4HANA Cloud implementation. 

It provides a clear guided methodology to deploy, adopt and extend new capabilities across your organization. Start fast, build smart, and run simple, while continuously innovating with SAP Activate. 

Public Cloud + SAP Activate = Game Changer. 

SAP Activate breaks every task into Six easy-to-understand phases: 

  • Discover Phase 
  • Prepare Phase 
  • Explore Phase 
  • Realize Phase 
  • Deploy Phase 
  • Run 

Real time experience: 

Let me walk you through our recent project to show you how this works in practice. 

Week 1-2: Discover Phase 

What we consultant did: Met with business users to understand their business needs. 

Advantage of Activate: Pre-built questionnaires as no miss on any important things. 

Time saved: Instead of creating requirements from scratch, we used proven templates. 

 Week 3-4: Prepare Phase 

What we consultant did: Got our system ready and planned the project.  

Advantage of Activate: Step-by-step setup guides and automatic system configuration. 

Time saved: No technical setup delays. 

 Week 5-8: Explore Phase 

What we consultant did: Designed our business processes using workshops. 

Advantage of Activate: "Fit-to-Standard" workshops with pre-configured demos. 

Time saved: Instead of explaining concepts, we showed working examples. 

 Week 9-14: Realize Phase 

What we consultant did: Built and tested our solution. 

Advantage of Activate: Migration tools, test scripts, and training templates already ready. 

Time saved: No custom development needed as we used 95% standard functionality. 

 Week 15-16: Deploy Phase &Run 

What we consultant did: Go-Live and started support to users. 

Advantage of Activate: Pre-built support processes and go-live checklists. 

Time saved: Smooth go-live with minimal issues. 

Why Public Cloud makes everything faster? 

  • As we combine public cloud with Activate it makes things faster, below are the points why it makes faster compared to S/4Hana. 
  • No infrastructure setup is required to implement. 
  • Automatic updates as you get new features every three months without any work. 
  • Preconfigured system as about 70 to 80 % of your setup is already done. 
  • Industry standard processes are already built in. 
  • Faster testing of scenarios. 
  • By leveraging the pre-delivered content, customers can jump-start the build using pre-built solutions as well as engineered services. With that, the SAP Activate framework provides a significant reduction in project time, reducing the Total Cost of Implementation (TCI) and Total Cost of Ownership (TCO). 

List of tools that accelerates the project: 

  • Fit-to-Standard workshop as it shows how the standard SAP processes work. 
  • Starter System it gives you a pre-configured system with sample master data to play with as user can use before they buy. 
  • Migration Cockpit it migrates data in days instead of months. 
  • Quality Gates is used to checkpoints make sure that everything is on track, Catches the problems early when they're easy to fix. 

 Conclusion:  By combining SAP Activate with the Public Cloud, companies can implement SAP solutions faster, smarter, and with less stress. The clear project phases, ready-to-use tools, and preconfigured processes help avoid delays, reduce costs, and deliver quick results. 

SAP Activate in the Public Cloud, you're not just implementing software, you're accelerating business transformation. 

 Reference Links: https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/managing-sap-s-4hana-cloud-public-edition-projects/describing-sap-activate?userlogin=true 

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-activate-in-under-9-minutes/ba-p/13569476 

https://me.sap.com/roadmapviewer/whatdoesroadmapoffer 

https://pages.community.sap.com/topics/activate

entry.title: Inquiry Regarding CDC Integration Between SAP Sybase ASE 16 and Google BigQuery
entry.content:
Hi all,

I am currently working on a data integration project involving two servers hosted on Google Cloud Platform. One of the servers is running SAP Sybase ASE 16, and the other is utilizing Google BigQuery. I am exploring the possibility of implementing a Change Data Capture (CDC) mechanism to synchronize data between these two systems.

I understand that the BigQuery Toolkit primarily supports SAP ERP and S/4HANA environments. However, I would like to inquire whether SAP offers any creative or alternative solutions that could facilitate CDC from SAP Sybase ASE 16 to BigQuery, either directly or through intermediate tools or services.

Your guidance and recommendations would be greatly appreciated, especially regarding any supported tools, configurations, or best practices that could help achieve this integration.

Thank you in advance for your assistance.

Best regards,

Itzik

entry.title: Re: Dynamic Configuration in SAP Integration Suite: One Tenant, Multiple Environments
entry.content:
@jantuma

you mentioned:

 

  • To target the TEST system, you deploy another instance of the same artifact and set ENV to TEST.
  • To target the PROD system, you deploy a third instance of the same artifact and set ENV to PROD.

 

Unfortunatelly there is no option to have one iflow deployed with multiple configuration set. Here are requests from Customer influence program concerning this topic:

https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/273979/?section=sectionVotes

https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/279300/?section=sectionVotes

 

Your approach to make configuration dynamic is great, but does not solve the problem of having one iflow in design time and multiple runtime versions with different configuration set up (as this was possible in PI thanks to separation of ESR from ID).

entry.title: Re: Quote Replication from S/4HANA On-Premise to SAP Sale...
entry.content:
Dear Giovanni 

No, automatic sync replication is not possible as of july 2025. To enable this functionnality you would need to implement a custom integration.

Best regards

Ndubuisi

entry.title: Re: Start and Stop recording audio not working in web app...
entry.content:
Dear Harini

Did you make sure you are using Https and navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia() permissions are granted?

As a workaround, have you considered 

- manually creating File object and assign to audioFile?

- using built in flow functions?

- using custom javascript with media recorder?

Best regards

Ndubuisi
